Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Trustan
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.

Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Cholesterol normal, thyroid monitoring normal, pap-smear monitoring normal, non-smoker, no excessive alcohol use.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Normal clinical exam.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities detected
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Normal clinical exam.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Normal clinical exam.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations:

Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Cholesterol normal, thyroid monitoring normal, pap-smear monitoring normal, non-smoker, no excessive alcohol use.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities detected
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Previous LLETZ done, recent f/up PAP normal. Thyroid functions and antibodies normal, for U/S f/up every 6months
Vit D = 72 (high normal = good but need to monitor)
Hs-CRP very mildly raised at 1.1 (confers moderate risk)
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Comment Value: Previous LLETZ done, recent f/up PAP normal. Thyroid functions and antibodies normal, for U/S f/up every 6months
Vit D = 72 (high normal = good but need to monitor)
Hs-CRP very mildly raised at 1.1 (confers moderate risk)
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Comment Value: Previous LLETZ done, recent f/up PAP normal. Thyroid functions and antibodies normal, for U/S f/up every 6months
Vit D = 72 (high normal = good but need to monitor)
Hs-CRP very mildly raised at 1.1 (confers moderate risk)
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Well done on diligently following up your pap smears. This will ensure any new abnormal changes are identified with little delay.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities detected
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Vit D on the upper limits of normal due to supplementation. Monitor DHEA/Cortisol and stress response.
U-CRP slightyl raised indicating average risk to developing coronary artery disease in future.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities detected
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Comment Value: -Prioritise annual screening & look out for the conditions that have occurred in your family.
-Employ lifestyle habits that benefit your present & future health.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Prioritise annual screening & look out for the conditions that have occurred in your family.
-Employ lifestyle habits that benefit your present & future health.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Prioritise annual screening & look out for the conditions that have occurred in your family.
-Employ lifestyle habits that benefit your present & future health.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Vit D on the upper limits of normal due to supplementation. Monitor DHEA/Cortisol and stress response.
U-CRP slightyl raised indicating average risk to developing coronary artery disease in future.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Well done on diligently following up your pap smears. This will ensure any new abnormal changes are identified with little delay.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.

Overview Notes: Vit D on the upper limits of normal due to supplementation. Monitor DHEA/Cortisol and stress response.
U-CRP slightyl raised indicating average risk to developing coronary artery disease in future.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: None
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: Reluctant for SSRI. Trial Trepeline for sleep. Referred psychologist.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities detected
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.

Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: We started an approach to your stress and anxiety. Please follow up with us or your own doctor.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities detected
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Vit D on the upper limits of normal due to supplementation. Monitor DHEA/Cortisol and stress response.
U-CRP slightyl raised indicating average risk to developing coronary artery disease in future.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: We started an approach to your stress and anxiety. Please follow up with us or your own doctor.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: We started an approach to your stress and anxiety. Please follow up with us or your own doctor.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Well done on diligently following up your pap smears. This will ensure any new abnormal changes are identified with little delay.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Vit D on the upper limits of normal due to supplementation. Monitor DHEA/Cortisol and stress response.
U-CRP slightyl raised indicating average risk to developing coronary artery disease in future.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Generally well
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Generally well
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: VitalsNote

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: A mildly raised HsCRP indicates some background low grade inflammation. You do regular adequate exercise and follow a healthy diet. To reduce ongoing background inflammation more practice mindfulness, manage stress levels and take a good Omega 3.

Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Well done on diligently following up your pap smears. This will ensure any new abnormal changes are identified with little delay.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
------------------------------
Employee: Alison Badenhorst
Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Please repeat your Pap smear as advised. The early detection of abnormalities can save lives.

U-CRP slightyl raised indicating average risk to developing coronary artery disease in future.

Report Date: 2020-09-22
Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Well done on diligently following up your pap smears. This will ensure any new abnormal changes are identified with little delay.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Doctor: 
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear
Overview Notes: Monitor DHEA and cortisol. You need to reduce your stress response to get the ratios back in balance. If you become majorly fatigued, with recurrent infections, a low mood and reduced sex drive consider discussing DHEA supplementation with one of us.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.

Overview Notes: Stop Vitamin D3 supplement for at least a month. To monitor levels before starting Vit D supplement again. If within normal range take once-twice a week.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA low at 1.6, normal cortisol. DHEA:Cortisol ratio decreased at 3.8.
